I think it's a reasonable expectation (though certainly not protected in any legal sense) that the things you buy continue to hold value commensurate with whatever else you might have spent it on.

Suppose someone spends all their IP on runes and has zero champions, while another spends all their IP on champions and has no runes.  Then runes are eliminated with no compensation (i understand that Riot is considering a method of compensation).  Seems a little unfair.  Is Riot obligated to make it 'fair'?  Of course not.  But they can and most often do try to make things fair.

I don't know, it's not that big a deal in any case, but that's how i see it.

What you say here is true, but misses the point. Riot loses little when they permanently ban a toxic player who happened to have paid money for content. It can be reasonably argued that Riot gains from doing so, by improving the player experience such that other players are more willing to purchase RP. Indeed, an incredibly small fraction of players are permanently banned. Most people don't care that the toxic player receives no recompense, or that the toxic player is upset that they receive no recompense. 

When Riot changes the runes system in the upcoming preseason, literally every single active player will be affected. If Riot chooses to provide no compensation, they create a LOT of consumer ill-will. It's a completely different situation. Instead of a tiny fraction of upset people, you suddenly have a near-universal percentage of players upset at a lack of recompense.

They haven't said how they plan on compensating players who spent IP or RP on the old runes, but they have said that they're working on something. I wouldn't expect to get your IP back if I were you though. That would be a logistical nightmare for Riot to give refunds to millions of players across the world over years and years of transactions.
Rioters have said that they definitely are going to compensate in some way. To what extent? We don't know yet.
I'm worried more or so about the rune pages I spent almost 30 dollars on.

Runes were never sold through RP, since Riot didn't want a pay-to-win model.  Rune *pages*, however could be purchased through RP.  And I'd be interested in how those will be handled.

They will definently do something to refund, but it hasn't been decided completely yet, and we will get updated when they. Also, getting IP back would suck for those who already have all champions. Though that's another problem entirely. They should add more things to spend IP on. Even like an icon that costs an absurd amount of IP would be cool.
